s0022: Therefore the principles are lowly and easy to implement.
s0023: What the customs desire, therefore grant it;
s0024: what the customs reject, therefore remove it.
s0025: In his governance, he was good at turning calamity into fortune, converting defeat into success.
s0026: Valued balancing light and heavy, was careful with weights and measures.
s0027: Duke Huan truly angry at Shao Ji, south attacked Cai, Guan Zhong therefore attacked Chu, blamed them for not contributing bundled thatch to the Zhou court.
s0028: Duke Huan truly north campaigned against the Shan Rong, yet Guan Zhong therefore commanded Yan to restore Duke Shao's governance.
s0029: At the Kui meeting, Duke Huan wished to renege on Cao Mo's agreement, Guan Zhong therefore kept faith with it, the feudal lords therefore turned to Qi.
s0030: Therefore said: 'Knowing that giving is taking, is the treasure of governance.'
s0032: Guan Zhong's wealth equaled the ducal house, had three wives' quarters and return stands, the people of Qi did not consider it extravagant.
s0033: Guan Zhong died, Qi state followed his governance, constantly strong among the feudal lords.
s0034: Over a hundred years later there was Yan Zi.
s0035: Yan Ping Zhong Ying was a man of Yi Wei in Lai.
s0036: Served Duke Ling, Duke Zhuang, Duke Jing of Qi, with frugality and diligent conduct was honored in Qi.
s0037: Having become prime minister of Qi, did not eat meat twice, concubines did not wear silk.
s0038: When in court, if the lord's words touched on it, then spoke dangerously;
s0039: if words did not touch on it, then acted dangerously.
s0040: If the state had the way, then obeyed commands;
s0041: if without the way, then balanced commands.
s0042: With this made famous name among the feudal lords for three generations.
